Time for some good news.....

Bad Axe High School was recently recognized again as one of the very best High Schools in America for 2020 in a report released by U.S. News & World Report. The High School received a rating that was given to public schools deemed to be the top in the country out of over 24,000 schools across all fifty states.

In Michigan, BAHS was ranked #121 out of 1,147 schools and was the highest ranked High School in Huron County. The report also compares High Schools across the country in which Bad Axe was ranked in the top 14% out of over 24,000 schools.

The rankings are based on school data that measures student performance, graduation rates, serving at-risk students, and preparedness for college-level coursework.

To read more about the US News and World Report‚Äôs findings or to look up High School‚Äôs across the country go to the link https://www.usnews.com/education/best-high-schools for more information.

The Bad Axe Middle School held its Second Annual Change to Make a Change Competition. Each homeroom class was challenged to bring in spare change which would be donated to the Huron County Toys for Tots Program.

The students, families, and staff dug deep during the two-week competition. Last year, BAMS raised a total of $733.54; however, this year they almost doubled it with raising a grand total of $1, 397.98!

Out of the ten classes, the top three classes (Mr. Kervin, Mrs. Wolverton, and Mrs. Posluszny) raised over $250 dollars with being less than $14 dollars apart. The bigger shock was that the top two classrooms were only $1.02 apart! The winning classroom went to Mr. Kervin‚Äôs homeroom ($269.08) with Mrs. Wolverton‚Äôs homeroom ($268.06) in a very close second!

So far, over 109 presents were donated and presented to Huron County Toys for Tots.

Thank you to everyone for all of the generous donations to help make someone else‚Äôs holiday season a little brighter!

Note: Below are pictures of the 109 presents donated so far!

post_text:
In honor of Michigan College Month (October), students and staff took place in a Door Decorating Contest to help students become more aware of their options after high school. College is defined as any training beyond high school that results in a credential (certificates, associates, bachelors, etc.). The students and staff had lots of fun decorating and showing off their spirit! Winners are listed below.
1st Place: Mr. Schadd's Shop Class
2nd Place: Mrs. Kervin's English II Class
3rd Place: Mrs. Sutherland's American History Class & Mrs. Smith in the Media Center
